DeepCover v0.1.16
activesupport/lib/active_support/cache/memory_store.rb
1# frozen_string_literal: true
2
3require "monitor"
4
5module ActiveSupport
6 module Cache
7 # A cache store implementation which stores everything into memory in the
8 # same process. If you're running multiple Ruby on Rails server processes
9 # (which is the case if you're using Phusion Passenger or puma clustered mode),
10 # then this means that Rails server process instances won't be able
11 # to share cache data with each other and this may not be the most
12 # appropriate cache in that scenario.
13 #
14 # This cache has a bounded size specified by the :size options to the
15 # initializer (default is 32Mb). When the cache exceeds the allotted size,
16 # a cleanup will occur which tries to prune the cache down to three quarters
17 # of the maximum size by removing the least recently used entries.
18 #
19 # MemoryStore is thread-safe.
20 class MemoryStore < Store
21 def initialize(options = nil)
22 options ||= {}
23 super(options)
24 @data = {}
25 @key_access = {}
26 @max_size = options[:size] || 32.megabytes
27 @max_prune_time = options[:max_prune_time] || 2
28 @cache_size = 0
29 @monitor = Monitor.new
30 @pruning = false
31 end
32
33 # Delete all data stored in a given cache store.
34 def clear(options = nil)
35 synchronize do
36 @data.clear
37 @key_access.clear
38 @cache_size = 0
39 end
40 end
41
42 # Preemptively iterates through all stored keys and removes the ones which have expired.
43 def cleanup(options = nil)
44 options = merged_options(options)
45 instrument(:cleanup, size: @data.size) do
46 keys = synchronize { @data.keys }
47 keys.each do |key|
48 entry = @data[key]
49 delete_entry(key, options) if entry && entry.expired?
50 end
51 end
52 end
53
54 # To ensure entries fit within the specified memory prune the cache by removing the least
55 # recently accessed entries.
56 def prune(target_size, max_time = nil)
57 return if pruning?
58 @pruning = true
59 begin
60 start_time = Time.now
61 cleanup
62 instrument(:prune, target_size, from: @cache_size) do
63 keys = synchronize { @key_access.keys.sort { |a, b| @key_access[a].to_f <=> @key_access[b].to_f } }
64 keys.each do |key|
65 delete_entry(key, options)
66 return if @cache_size <= target_size || (max_time && Time.now - start_time > max_time)
67 end
68 end
69 ensure
70 @pruning = false
71 end
72 end
73
74 # Returns true if the cache is currently being pruned.
75 def pruning?
76 @pruning
77 end
78
79 # Increment an integer value in the cache.
80 def increment(name, amount = 1, options = nil)
81 modify_value(name, amount, options)
82 end
83
84 # Decrement an integer value in the cache.
85 def decrement(name, amount = 1, options = nil)
86 modify_value(name, -amount, options)
87 end
88
89 # Deletes cache entries if the cache key matches a given pattern.
90 def delete_matched(matcher, options = nil)
91 options = merged_options(options)
92 instrument(:delete_matched, matcher.inspect) do
93 matcher = key_matcher(matcher, options)
94 keys = synchronize { @data.keys }
95 keys.each do |key|
96 delete_entry(key, options) if key.match(matcher)
97 end
98 end
99 end
100
101 def inspect # :nodoc:
102 "<##{self.class.name} entries=#{@data.size}, size=#{@cache_size}, options=#{@options.inspect}>"
103 end
104
105 # Synchronize calls to the cache. This should be called wherever the underlying cache implementation
106 # is not thread safe.
107 def synchronize(&block) # :nodoc:
108 @monitor.synchronize(&block)
109 end
110
111 private
112
113 PER_ENTRY_OVERHEAD = 240
114
115 def cached_size(key, entry)
116 key.to_s.bytesize + entry.size + PER_ENTRY_OVERHEAD
117 end
118
119 def read_entry(key, options)
120 entry = @data[key]
121 synchronize do
122 if entry
123 @key_access[key] = Time.now.to_f
124 else
125 @key_access.delete(key)
126 end
127 end
128 entry
129 end
130
131 def write_entry(key, entry, options)
132 entry.dup_value!
133 synchronize do
134 old_entry = @data[key]
135 return false if @data.key?(key) && options[:unless_exist]
136 if old_entry
137 @cache_size -= (old_entry.size - entry.size)
138 else
139 @cache_size += cached_size(key, entry)
140 end
141 @key_access[key] = Time.now.to_f
142 @data[key] = entry
143 prune(@max_size * 0.75, @max_prune_time) if @cache_size > @max_size
144 true
145 end
146 end
147
148 def delete_entry(key, options)
149 synchronize do
150 @key_access.delete(key)
151 entry = @data.delete(key)
152 @cache_size -= cached_size(key, entry) if entry
153 !!entry
154 end
155 end
156
157 def modify_value(name, amount, options)
158 synchronize do
159 options = merged_options(options)
160 if num = read(name, options)
161 num = num.to_i + amount
162 write(name, num, options)
163 num
164 end
165 end
166 end
167 end
168 end
169end
